So from the latest posts in announcements, thought this was cool gem to discover:
`<https://app.HubSpot.com/portal-recommend/l?slug=[adding> a slug here will allow a user to select a portal and go to that area]`

example: <https://app.HubSpot.com/portal-recommend/l?slug=design-manager>

You should see a portal selection, then it will take you to the DM for that portal
might come in handy for the chrome extension

Try just page#unique-id

Just an FYI - the Privacy Badger extension (available for Chrome, Opera, Firefox, and FF on Android) seem to block the loading of comments on blog posts in HubSpot
<http://eff.org/privacybadger|eff.org/privacybadger>

Which means the comments literally won't display at all :white_frowning_face:

This is my output from the extension:```Privacy Badger (<http://www.eff.org/privacybadger|www.eff.org/privacybadger>) found 13 potential trackers at ***-***.<http://hs-sites.com|hs-sites.com>:

<http://staticxx.facebook.com|staticxx.facebook.com>
<http://apis.google.com|apis.google.com>
<http://www.google.com|www.google.com>
<http://api.hubapi.com|api.hubapi.com>
<http://app.HubSpot.com|app.HubSpot.com>
<http://forms.HubSpot.com|forms.HubSpot.com>
<http://track.HubSpot.com|track.HubSpot.com>
<http://platform.linkedin.com|platform.linkedin.com>
<http://sb.scorecardresearch.com|sb.scorecardresearch.com>
<http://api-widget.soundcloud.com|api-widget.soundcloud.com>
<http://w.soundcloud.com|w.soundcloud.com>
<http://platform.twitter.com|platform.twitter.com>
<http://syndication.twitter.com|syndication.twitter.com>```

There are three settings to Privacy Badger - Block, Block Cookies, and Allow. When I set all the `.<http://hubapi.com|hubapi.com>` and `.<http://HubSpot.com|HubSpot.com>` domains to the "Block Cookies" setting, the blog comments started working again
Did someone say hackathon?
